snippet: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg said Thursday that 2,500 teaching jobs would be restored, while avoiding tax increases, but he could still cut funding for child care and after-school programs.
abstract: New York City Mayor Michael R Bloomberg says that an infusion of almost half a billion dollars from the settlement over the CityTime payroll scandal will allow 2,500 teaching jobs that were eliminated in the budget to be restored, while avoiding tax increases; funding could still be cut for child care and after-school programs, fire companies and libraries.

byline.original: By DAVID W. CHEN and KATE TAYLOR

lead_paragraph: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg said Thursday that 2,500 teaching jobs would be restored, while avoiding tax increases, but he could still cut funding for child care and after-school programs.

headline.seo: Bloomberg Restores 2,500 Teaching Jobs in Latest Budget Proposal
headline.main: Settlement in Payroll Scandal Gives Mayor’s Budget a Lift
headline.print_headline: Settlement in Payroll Scandal Giving Mayor’s Budget a Lift
